newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: India sells Madras naphtha to Vitol at -$22.28/T.
newsitem.headline: India sells Madras naphtha to Vitol at -$22.28/T.

text.p: State-owned Indian Oil Corp (IOC) has sold by tender 27,000 tonnes of high aromatic naphtha (HAN) lifting March 27-29 from Madras on the east coast to Dutch trader Vitol at $22.28 per tonne below Japanese spot quotes, industry sources said on Monday.
The tender which closed March 20 and was valid for a day, sought bids on a free-on-board (fob) basis.
IOC's last HAN cargo from Madras which lifted January 5-7 was awarded at a $16.65 per tonne discount to Japanese spot quotes, fob.
